subdefinitions.definition: To remove ; to take away ; withdraw .
subdefinitions.dating_raw: First attested in the late 15 century.

subdefinitions.definition: To steal ; to take away; to remove without permission.
subdefinitions.dating_raw: First attested in the late 15 century.

subdefinitions.definition: To extract by means of distillation .
subdefinitions.dating_raw: Attested from the early 17 century until the early 18 century.
First attested in the mid 17 century.

subdefinitions.definition: To consider abstractly; to contemplate separately or by itself; to consider theoretically; to look at as a general quality. [First attested in the early 17 century.] To conceptualize an ideal subgroup by means of the generalization of an attribute , as follows: by apprehending an attribute inherent to one individual, then separating that attribute and contemplating it by itself, then conceiving of that attribute as a general quality, then despecifying that conceived quality with respect to several or many individuals, and by then ideating a group composed of those individuals perceived to possess said quality. ( intransitive , rare ) To perform the process of abstraction . ( intransitive , fine arts ) To create abstractions. ( intransitive , computing ) To produce an abstraction , usually by refactoring existing code. Generally used with "out".

definitions.definition: To summarize ; to abridge ; to epitomize .
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the late 16 century.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To separate ; to disengage. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To summarize ; to abridge ; to epitomize . [First attested in the late 16 century.]
